intro: Pinalia japonica, commonly known as the Japanese pincushion plant, is a flowering species native to Japan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its dense, spiny bracts that resemble a pincushion, giving it its common name. It produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Pinalia japonica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils in full sun.
